function_call.name: eval_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":["Lack of new safety procedures for pandemic response","Vulnerability of construction workers to covid-19","Construction workers sharing equipment and facilities are susceptible to virus transmission without proper precautions","Services offered by construction workers can act as a potential catalyst for virus transmission, including covid-19","Public construction projects are essential for the economy but pose a risk of virus transmission among workers","Air conditioning contributing to the spread of the virus in indoor environments","Decreased demand for public transportation impacting construction projects","Lack of cleanliness and sanitization on construction sites","Increased medical waste generation during the pandemic, posing a risk to the environment and public health","Potential transmission of covid-19 among construction workers due to proximity in the work environment","Failure to clearly define and communicate zones of safety and hazard in the work environment, leading to increased risk of workers entering hazardous areas unintentionally","Economic pressures and workload leading to workers being pushed into hazardous work conditions, increasing the risk of accidents and injuries","Limited funds availability for transportation agencies due to covid-19","Decrease in tax revenues due to limited consumer investment and economic activity","Struggle to attract riders back onto public conveyances due to pandemic concerns","30% decline in cp revenue projected nationwide","Construction projects delayed or temporarily stopped due to budget cuts and income decrease","Slowdown in project planning, design activities, inspections, and maintenance due to social distancing","Covid-19 causing disruption in construction industry workforce","Disruption of construction activity due to the socio-economic-environmental impacts of covid-19 pandemic","Adverse impact on infrastructure due to reduced workforce and increased healthcare costs","Vulnerability of populations with poor air quality to pandemics","High infectivity rate of covid-19","Underestimated modes of transmission","Impacted medical practice","Viral shedding in feces and other body fluids despite resolution of symptoms","Risk of transmission through sharing of toilets","Viral presence in body fluids such as saliva, urine, semen, and tears","Transmission of virus through aerosols and droplets during surgical and dental procedures as well as from infected patients while talking, coughing, and sneezing.","Virus transmission through contaminated surfaces fomites and the viability of the virus in aerosols for up to 3 hours and on different surfaces for 4-72 hours.","Potential transmission of the virus through the gastrointestinal tract.","Possible modes of transmission of sars-cov-2 including airborne transmission via aerosols.","Potential risk of cross-contamination from stainless steel surfaces due to inadequate cleaning procedures and disinfectant application.","No in vitro data on efficacy of hand washing against coronavirus contamination on hands.","Human coronaviruses can remain infectious on inanimate surfaces for up to 9 days.","Uncertain viral load on inanimate surfaces","Unknown frequency of hand contamination with coronavirus","Conflicting data on benzalkonium chloride efficacy against coronavirus at different concentrations and contact times.","Long persistence of coronaviruses on inanimate surfaces, up to 9 days at room temperature and 28 days at higher temperatures.","High transfer efficiency of viral load to hands from contaminated surfaces, with potential transfer to the face and mucous membranes.","Coronavirus persistence on surfaces and materials","Variation in coronavirus persistence based on temperature and humidity","Effectiveness of biocidal agents in inactivating coronaviruses","Person-to-person transmission of coronavirus in hospital and family settings.","Contaminated dry surfaces serving as a potential source of coronavirus transmission.","Insufficient understanding of coronavirus persistence on inanimate surfaces.","Lack of preparation for a larger variety of possible disruptions in the construction industry","Unforeseen impact of pandemics on the construction industry and end users","Lack of knowledge, experience, and readiness in managing pandemics","Health and safety risks in indoor spaces due to covid-19","Lack of personal space and outdoor spaces in current housing stock","Increased remote working leading to prolonged indoor exposure","Shift in housing interior trends towards healthier and touch-free technologies"]}
